str2: To have in full, be far, it is enough. From apo and echo; to have out, i.e. Receive in full; to keep away, i.e. Be distant.
Neuter of a compound of eidolon and a presumed derivative of thuo; an image-sacrifice, i.e. Part of an idolatrous offering.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.

word: from the meat of strangled animals,
str2: Strangled (i.e. killed without letting out the blood). From pnigo; throttled, i.e. an animal choked to death.
Fornication, whoredom; met: idolatry. From porneuo; harlotry; figuratively, idolatry.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To do, perform, accomplish; be in any condition, i.e. I fare; I exact, require.
Well, well done, good, rightly; also used as an exclamation. Neuter of a primary eus; well.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To keep safe, hold fast. From dia and tereo; to watch thoroughly, i.e. to observe strictly, or to avoid wholly.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Plural
Verb - Perfect Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Prolongation from rhoomai; to strengthen, i.e. have health.
